content.description: Climb the southwest dihedral as shown in the photo.  Nice little route to an island summit.
content.location: One of the first routes that you encounter as you come up the Potholes Trail.  It is to your left as you approach Red Rocks (see photo).  To descend downclimb the northwest corner (5.2 access or descent route), step over the cleft to the northeast or rap off the large tree.

content.description: The Red Rocks Overhang is a fun short climb on the south wall of Red Rocks.  It is straight ahead of you behind a tree as you pass up through the gap in the Red Rocks. Climb up the face using smaller blocky holds.  When you reach the overhang reach up above and choose the most positive of the small horizontal cracks to pass over the overhang.Once you get above the overhang you've only got a few easier moves to the top.

The Red Rocks Chimney ascends the dihedral/chimney behind the large tree just above the gap in the Red Rocks.  Climb using the dihedral crack and ledges (not the tree) and finish by squeezing through the converging chimney at the top.
Climb ledges and cracks up the face.  Fun little climb.  Just follow the line of least resistance.    Staying tight to the left corner is 5.8.
content.location: Located on an outside face between Inside Corner and Red Rocks Overhang.  Walk off to the left and back down the Potholes Trail.

content.description: If your climbing here you are probably looking for easy routes.  So you might just as well do this one also.  Not a bomb, but definitely not more than one star.
content.protection: Light rack, trees up top for anchor.
content.location: This is the last route on the main wall.  Walk up the trail between the rocks, pass a large tree on your right, pass a short face then turn right and look at the inside corner.  Walk off to the left and back down the Potholes Trail.
located up the trail and to the left from many of the climbs in red rocks. These climbs are located on the backside of the formation up the trail

climbs.name: Between the lines
climbs.fa: FTR: Bechler/Sangdahl crew c1980  FL: Eggert?

content.description: Make your way past the first overhang to the overhanging upper face with the dual cracks.  Don't be surprised how good the left pocket is (not).
content.protection: TR only.  You would not want to pitch off the upper face inside this micro canyon.
content.location: The guides talk about 5.8 and 5.9 crack lines inside the corridor as an alternative to the (dubious) easy stem route between the walls.  This wall is just to the right of the 5.9 crack in the east corridor.

content.description: The Red Rocks formation straddles the Potholes Trail about 3/4 of the way up the bluff.  The formation contains a dozen moderate climbs, the highest of which is about 25 feet high.
